title: fix: prevent prettification from hallucinating app names
author: ElliotEtag

gist.headline: Taming the Chaos Commander
gist.blurb: The AI got a little too creative, renaming apps on a whim. We've reminded it that names are not optional suggestions.
gist.summary: Added context guardrails to the prettification pipeline to prevent the LLM from hallucinating new names for existing apps.
gist.impact: App names in the showcase will now correctly match what their creators called them, rather than what the AI felt like calling them.
gist.visual_concept: The robot (representing the AI) is enthusiastically mislabeling things with exciting names like 'Chaos Commander', while the Bee (the maintainer) follows behind with a clipboard and a label maker, correcting them back to their boring real names.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the cute bee mascot helping a chunky robot organize a shelf of software boxes. The robot holds a box labeled 'CHAOS COMMANDER', but the bee is correcting it with a label gun. Lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Pixel font text on boxes. Nostalgic but beautiful.
